I have social anxiety, CPTSD, and depression and I think thereâ€™s absolutely a line between what is caused by work and what just is. 

My CPTSD didnâ€™t come from work, it came from childhood trauma. And thatâ€™s something that I want to heal from beyond issues related to work. 

My social anxiety and depression are essentially genetic. My whole family suffers with various levels of anxiety and depression.

I think work is really just something that exacerbates everything. Without work, I would still be mentally ill and I would still want to heal. Work makes it harder because I have less time to focus on recovery and I have to be around people everyday which is anxiety inducing and when I donâ€™t have enough time to do things I love I feel more depressed. But those things would exist without work. 

I think it depends on the person, but most of the time work is an exacerbating factor, not the cause.

My therapist gave me a couple reasons she thinks I have them. 

My brother has severe anger issues and needed a lot of attention growing up because of that. A lot of the time my parents would put the blame on me or on both of us rather than just him (weâ€™re now 22 and 24 and to this day that still happens). A lot of times I would also miss out on attention because they were focused on what he needed. So basically I was emotionally neglected. 

My therapist mostly said this was why. That even when I thought my parents were there for me, they would â€œleaveâ€. And I ended up with abandonment issues.
